intro: Rinorea kaessneri, commonly known as the silverleaf rinorea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that have a silvery underside, giving it its common name. It produces small, pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Rinorea kaessneri is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
